description: This cassata cake combines moist sponge layers with rich ricotta filling and light whipped cream frosting.
ingredients: [{"name": "all-purpose flour", "units": "cups", "amount": 2}, {"name": "granulated sugar", "units": "cups", "amount": 1.5}, {"name": "large eggs", "units": "pieces", "amount": 4}, {"name": "unsalted butter", "units": "cups", "amount": 0.5}, {"name": "whole milk", "units": "cups", "amount": 1}, {"name": "baking powder", "units": "teaspoons", "amount": 2}, {"name": "vanilla extract", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": 1}, {"name": "salt", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": 0.5}, {"name": "whole milk ricotta cheese", "units": "ounces", "amount": 32}, {"name": "powdered sugar", "units": "cups", "amount": 1.5}, {"name": "mini chocolate chips", "units": "cups", "amount": 1}, {"name": "orange zest", "units": "cups", "amount": 0.25}, {"name": "lemon zest", "units": "tablespoons", "amount": 2}, {"name": "cinnamon", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": 1}, {"name": "orange liqueur", "units": "cups", "amount": 0.5}, {"name": "simple syrup", "units": "cups", "amount": 0.25}, {"name": "heavy whipping cream", "units": "cups", "amount": 2}, {"name": "powdered sugar for frosting", "units": "cups", "amount": 0.5}, {"name": "candied fruit", "units": "cups", "amount": 0.25}, {"name": "chopped pistachios", "units": "tablespoons", "amount": 2}]
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350Â°F. Prepare two 9-inch cake pans with parchment. Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time. Combine dry ingredients separately. Alternate adding dry ingredients and milk to butter mixture. Divide batter between pans and bake 25-30 minutes until golden and springy. Cool completely. 2. Drain ricotta in fine mesh strainer for 30 minutes. Combine drained ricotta with powdered sugar, citrus zests, and cinnamon. Fold in chocolate chips. Refrigerate filling for 30 minutes. 3. Slice each cake layer horizontally into two even layers. Brush each layer with orange liqueur and simple syrup mixture. Spread ricotta filling between layers, stacking evenly. Refrigerate assembled cake for 1 hour. 4. Whip chilled heavy cream with powdered sugar until stiff peaks form. Apply crumb coat to chilled cake and refrigerate 15 minutes. Apply final frosting layer and decorate with candied fruit and pistachios. 5. Refrigerate completed cake for at least 4 hours or overnight before serving. Use sharp knife dipped in hot water for clean slices.
notes: For optimal cake texture, ensure all refrigerated ingredients like eggs and milk reach room temperature before beginning.
